title: For loop (HELP on python)
body:
n = int(raw_input())
for i in xrange(0,n):
    print "*",

This is how it works!!!

raw_input() is for taking input. In python, the input is taken as a string by default. So, we need to convert it to int

xrange(0,n) means an iteration from 0 to n-1.

the comma in the print statement is for printing the output on the same line. More appropriately, the , keeps the cursor on the present line after printing, unlike the print statement without a , at the end.

Hope this helps!!!
